climbs.name: What A Drag It Is Getting Old
climbs.fa: S.Powers and Frazier Haney & Todd Gordon

content.description: bunch of bolts..(about 5 ?)....the climbing is cool, until the top, then the moves and rock aren't so good.....too bad, because the rest of the climb (lower part) is really fun.....the top moves are really hard too......which was irritating.....
content.location:
Located in a narrow corridor to the left of

Pops

(I believe)....but you approach the climb from the Parking which is to the NW.....anyways;.....it's on the left side of the corridor

climbs.name: Thomson Roof
climbs.fa: Reggie Thomson, Todd Gordon, Scott Gordon, Mike Brown & Howard Boyd, December 1985

content.description: On the back side (Opposite "The Chief") of the Reggie Dome you will find a large roof of darker rock. To the right approx 20ft? there is a smaller roof with a crack system above it. The start is off the ground to an awkward move to the right and then a step over to the left below the roof. Going right or left at that point depending on height/weight/whatever works. A small rack is all that is needed as the climb is very, very short. 50m rope is plenty and then some. There are also a couple of other climbs not listed on this site worth looking into. A short two bolt job in the corridor to the right (Felt like maybe 5.8 at best. New I think) with great anchors to rap from. Another to the left that we did not get on yet. but looked interesting.
content.protection: Small amount of pro needed, small to medium, cams in particular in the horizontal below the roof, nuts above worked great. No anchors on top so build yourself.

climbs.name: Thompson's Acne
climbs.fa: (TR) Nino Botelho & Agust Agustsson, 10/89, FL: Alan Bartlett, 2/96

content.description: Crux at the start, then face climbing up until it meets with the same anchor as fender bender.    Climb #128 in Vogel's guide.
content.protection: No pro for quite awhile, can top rope from fender bender.
content.location: On the corner, left of Ninny's Revenge and right of Fender Bender

content.description:
There are two mixed climbs to the left of a long bolted route (

Fresh Squeezed

). This is the left one.

Climbs some very tender flake past two bolts up the slab to a very clean crack to the top.

Although not one to seek out it was worth it for the crack above.
content.protection: Two bolts protect the moves to the crack above. Standard rack to a two bolt belay rap.
content.location: Located to the left of Fresh Squeezed on the southwest corner of Reggie Dome.

content.description:
A fun little mixed pitch that stays far enough right of the terrible rock to warrant climbing.  Moves up the lower slab to the left of

Fresh Squeezed

past a couple buttonheads and straight up to a crack weakness in the headwall.  A couple bouldery moves leads to easy climbing on the jug-lined crack.  2-bolt anchor lies way up and over the bad rock at the top.
content.protection: Mixed: 2 bolts down low and a couple of medium sized pieces for the top.
content.location:
Starts just left of

Fresh Squeezed

content.description: The only difficulty to this slab climb is a smeary move encountered down low, so this r/x climb makes a great solo since the top is easy. Well, even easier.
content.protection: 4 bolts, 2-bolt anchor
content.location: The left most route on the main NW face of Reggie Dome

climbs.name: Short Cut
climbs.fa: Steve Sutton and Alan Bartlett, January 1996

content.description: This is a mildly overhanging face with large, positive holds.  After the first bolt is a fun hand traverse to the left.  The crux move is an insecure step up to a no hands stance, just after the traverse.  Some delicate 5.9 moves take you to the top.
content.protection: 3 bolts plus gear for the anchor
content.location: This is on a separate boulder in front of the main formation, and well to the right of Handicapped Zone.

content.description: Climb the chimney (near the start of Ninny's Revenge) to reach a wide crack on the right, then zig zag up fun cracks above.
content.protection: Standard rack.

content.description:
This route is on the northwest face of Reggie Dome and climbs the prominent dike system immediately left of The Chief.

A bouldery start gains access to the "staircased" dike and a solitary bolt about 15' above the start. Higher, the dike dies out briefly and wild moves around a flake give access to the upper portion of the dike which ends at the same spot The Chief does.

There are two options for descending this route (and The Chief) - scrambling down an easy gully to the north or by rappelling from anchors (95' rap) atop the large slab just left of this route.   A fun route that offers better protection than appearances might first suggest, this is a worthwhile route to do when in the vicinty. Two stars out of five.
content.protection: Bolt (5/16"), gear to 3"

content.description:
Climb the steep patina face between Pops Goes Hawiian and The Chief.

From the initial crack of The Chief, step left and crank up some nice patina on slightly creaky holds.
content.protection: Toprope anchor: 2 to 3 inch CDs

content.description: Upon reaching Reggie Dome from Keys Corner, you will see a pine tree in front of a slab. Twenty feet to the right is an alcove with a tree in it. On the left wall of the alcove is an overhanging horizontal crack. This is Ninny's Revenge. Surmount the overhang (crux) at the bottom of the crack then follow the crack to a ledge. Climb the face (two bolts) above the ledge and head for the visible bolted anchor.
content.protection: Medium to large size cams, two bolts. Two bolt belay/rap anchor

content.description: This is the wild looking climb is just left of the Thomson Roof.  Four   bolts takes one up steep rock involving a couple of big bulges to nice sport anchors.
content.protection: Bolts, bolt anchor.  Maybe a cam or two to supplement bolts

content.description: Fun climb crux was down low.  Do the direct start and don't start left of it but right below it!
content.protection: Thin to 2 inches use gear for anchors.  Have to walk off.
content.location: It's on Reggie'd SouthWest Face.  If your looking at Reggie Dome THe face right of the chief has 3 climbs.  Look for the X cracks.

content.description: This is a slightly overhanging, knobby finger and hand crack - a very nice route.
content.protection: standard rack
content.location: This is at the left end of the east face, just left of The Mole.

content.description: This climb is located on the northwest face area.  It is on the far left side of the main slab and goes up a bucketed face.  Four bolts to a bolted anchor.  Left and around the corner from Speed Bump
content.protection: 4 bolts, anchors

content.description: This is a very nice climb, with finger and hand jamming, plus face moves on knobs.
content.protection: standard rack
content.location: The southwest face is split by a large ramp/gully.  To the right of this feature, the obvious inside corner is Curbside.  Handicapped Zone starts around to the right, at a crack.

content.description: The hairline crack between Speed Bump and Fender Bender (gained from the start of Fender Bender) and the cracks above.
content.protection: Standard rack

content.description:
Start amongst boulders and climb a curving crack up and right to the point where it becomes a horizontal (optional 2.5" pro here), then make an easy but committing move to reach the first bolt. Steep slab climbing (5.9) with positive edges continues up and right until a stance is reached below a short headwall. Steep, well-protected moves on incut patina edges lead up and left out the headwall (5.9), finishing with some slabby moves on slightly gritty rock.

The anchor on top is set well back from the edge and may require a walk off if long slings aren't in place. To descend head east and then back west along a series of ledges, pass a dubious-looking block and finish by downclimbing an easy chimney.

A fun and well-protected route that is ideal on cold days as well as escaping the crowds typical of more popular walls. Two stars out of five.
content.protection: 7 bolts (all 3/8"), anchors (1/2" SS); optional 2.5" piece for before the first bolt
content.location: Located just to the right of Tender Flakes of Wrath and Sunny Delight on the southwest corner of Reggie Dome.

content.description: On the approach to Reggie Dome a large dark face is the first thing encountered, facing west.  This face route runs up the middle of this rock, starting directly behind an obviously large pine tree.  Climb past a bolt and follow a 1/4 inch seam/crack protectable in only one place by a .75 camalot or similar.  40 feet later another bolt is encountered.  Go straight up here for harder moves, or veer left from the bolt and follow big holds to the top.  A bit contrived, and could use another bolt between the two existing to make it better for the beginner leader (it is beginner material)
content.protection:
Two bolts, small/medium cams.  Bolts/rings 90 feet up

Upgraded Pro now has 4 bolts as of 9/2015-A. Stackhouse

content.description: Crux was getting up on the dihedral and doing the lieback with some stem moves.  Fun climb if your there to do the Chief and Pop Goes Hawaiian might as well tick the 3 routes on the face, including this one.
content.protection: Gear is thin.  Can TR this with same TR anchor as Handicapped Zone and Meter Maid.
content.location:
It's the short left facing corner you'll know it looks like a nice lieback kind of dihedral.

Walk off

content.description:
This route starts up the gully several feet right of Ninny's Revenge. The crack runs to the right of another route (Pops Goes Hawaiian) with a single-bolt on the left face of the gully. The Chief is a fun route with good placements for pro and comfy stances for feet.

It is possible to rap from the top of Tender Flakes of Wrath (127 in Vogel's guide) or the route that runs up the center face, about straight up from the pine tree next to the northwest face.
content.protection: Hexes or large cams for natural anchor would be handy.
